name: Architecture
description: Structures built for human use, ranging from ancient to modern buildings.

associatedTypes.name: Building
associatedTypes.description: A structure with walls and a roof.

associatedTypes.name: Bridge
associatedTypes.description: A structure built to span a physical obstacle.

associatedTypes.name: Monument
associatedTypes.description: A statue, building, or other structure erected to commemorate a notable person or event.

associatedTypes.name: Statue
associatedTypes.description: A three-dimensional representation of a person or animal, often sculpted from stone or metal.

associatedTypes.name: Tower
associatedTypes.description: A tall, narrow building or structure that is often used for observation or as a lookout.

associatedTypes.name: Castle
associatedTypes.description: A large fortified building or complex, typically used as a residence and defensive structure.

name: Art
description: Creative works that express the artist's imagination and skill.

associatedTypes.name: Painting
associatedTypes.description: A work of art created by applying pigment to a surface.

associatedTypes.name: Sculpture
associatedTypes.description: A three-dimensional work of art created by shaping materials.

associatedTypes.name: Drawing
associatedTypes.description: A visual art form that involves marking a surface to create an image.

associatedTypes.name: Photography
associatedTypes.description: The art or practice of capturing images using a camera.

associatedTypes.name: Installation
associatedTypes.description: A three-dimensional work that transforms a space and engages the viewer.

name: History
description: Items related to past events and periods.

associatedTypes.name: Artifact
associatedTypes.description: An object made or used by humans, typically of historical or cultural interest.

associatedTypes.name: Document
associatedTypes.description: A written or printed paper that provides information or evidence.

associatedTypes.name: Photograph
associatedTypes.description: A visual representation of a person, place, or event from the past.

associatedTypes.name: Fossil
associatedTypes.description: The remains or impression of a prehistoric organism preserved in rock.

associatedTypes.name: Map
associatedTypes.description: A visual representation of an area that shows physical features and landmarks.

name: Science
description: Items related to scientific study and research.

associatedTypes.name: Specimen
associatedTypes.description: A sample of material used for scientific study.

associatedTypes.name: Model
associatedTypes.description: A three-dimensional representation of an object or concept.

associatedTypes.name: Instrument
associatedTypes.description: A tool used for scientific measurement or experimentation.

associatedTypes.name: Publication
associatedTypes.description: A written work that disseminates scientific knowledge or research findings.

associatedTypes.name: Data Set
associatedTypes.description: A collection of related data used for analysis and interpretation.

name: Culture
description: Items that reflect the traditions and practices of a community or society.

associatedTypes.name: Textile
associatedTypes.description: A type of fabric or cloth, often handmade and culturally significant.

associatedTypes.name: Ceremony Object
associatedTypes.description: Items used in cultural rituals and ceremonies.

associatedTypes.name: Musical Instrument
associatedTypes.description: A device used to produce musical sounds.

associatedTypes.name: Craft
associatedTypes.description: An item made by hand, often reflecting local traditions.

associatedTypes.name: Traditional Clothing
associatedTypes.description: Garments that are characteristic of a particular culture or community.
